title: DCI weekend
text: My wife and I were totally pleased with our stay at the Hyatt. Room was very nice, breakfast was great and we were treated with respect. We didn't have any complaints and would love to stay there again. Great location to the sports scene in Indianapolis.

title: Burgers and more burgers
text: A nice place to go to get a decent burger. Food was very good, fries were better than normal. Service could improve a little because it is very busy. They should add a dark beer on tap.

title: DCI weekend
text: Another large NFL stadium but still has charm. Sat in several areas and still had good view of the field.

title: Qcc
text: We stayed at the Hyatt during the DCI Competition week end. Treated with respect, quiet spacious room, clean and comfortable. The morning breakfast is something you shouldn't miss, especially the yogurt and fruit. Plenty of places to sit especially on the deck when the weather is nice.

title: DCI Competition
text: We agree with everything that is written about Mario's Pizza. Small place with big good food. A small pizza is enough for three. The calzone is even bigger and better. Will go back when in the area.

title: A keeper
text:
Pleasantly surprised but the friendlyness of the staff, they make you feel welcome. Room was clean, comfortable and quiet. What more can you ask for. Convenient location on the south side.
Would stay again when in the Rochester area.

title: Better comfort
text: Ordered the daily special and wasn't disappointed. They will accommodate your needs as well. Comfortable inside and easy to get to.

title: Home is where you hang your hat
text: Very nice place, convenient location if heading either north or south. Clean spacious room. Easy access, quiet to area. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast was included and even though it was the typical food it was hot and tasty.
place: La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham Chattanooga - East Ridge

title: Better late than never
text: Stop by near closing time and glad we did. We ordered from the specials menu and had very good food. U had a number 25 and my wife had a number 16. Both were very good. The chips and salsa was also very good. Service was very good and friendly.

title: Wife approved
text: I highly recommend the comfort suites at Forsyth. Convenient, friendly staff, accommodating and quiet. Towels were big and soft. The suite concept allowed for my wife to sleep longer while I watched some sports. Typical hot cold breakfast with plenty of places to sit.

title: Fish on Friday
text: Heard the Friday night fish fry was good and worth the wait. I agree wholeheartedly. I was surprised by the size of the tavern, crowded, cozy and warm. Parking can be a problem but all apart of the experience of eating at a neighborhood tavern.

title: Just passing through
text: WE were looking for a quiet place to stay and the motel met that goal. Beds were comfortable. Towels were a little thin but adequate. The breakfast was hot and cold but nothing to write home about. Would stay there again. It's not close to other restaurants.
place: Red Roof Inn & Suites Danville, IL

title: Off the beaten path
text: If you want a place to go to feel like you are along the Appalachian Trail try trails at sunderbruch park. Slippery when wet and lots of ups and downs. Enjoy the outdoors.

title: Just like home
text: Always looking for that pizza that tastes as good as the pizza we grew up with. Tony's is as close to that pizza, from the Pizza villa in LaCrosse. We like a thin crust pizza with Italian sausage and green olives. That is what we ordered at Tony's and enjoyed every piece. They also serve a deep dish pizza so we ordered a slice for comparison and it was very good as well.

title: Quiet and Comfortable
text: Needed a place to stay near Northern Kentucky University and this one fit the bill. Asked for a quiet room on the ground floor and got one in the back building. Only suggestion would be that the second story would have possibly been quieter as we could hear people above us.

title: Kentucky Proud
text: Was looking for a place to get a quick meal after the WGI event at Northern Kentucky University, decided to try Mac's. It was a Saturday evening and March Madness was in full bloom. Needless to say Mac's had every TV tuned to basketball and there are a lot of TVs in the place. So if you wanted to have a nice quiet supper this wasn't the place. It was hoppin. The food was very good to include the pizza and salads.

title: Spring Break
text: If you want a quiet meal at a local long term establishment try the Flagler Tavern on Flagler Ave, NSB. The main floor has live entertainment, the outside deck has entertainment plus the noise of the street but the upstairs is a quiet retreat from the hussel and bussel at the lower floors. My wife and I enjoy the food and quiet atmosphere of the upstairs. My wife always orders the Rock Shrimp and enjoys the effort to get to the real meal. I had the Fresh Haddock Sandwich where the haddock is done to perfection and "huge". We topped it off with a glass of Sangria and a nice dark beer. If Ross is on duty he will surely make you dining experience a pleasure.

title: Lots of food
text: Love to go to Manny's when we are in NSB. The food is served in generous portions and is good. My wife and I get a small greek salad and veggie calzone and take a small piece home. The girls ordered the regular portions of spaghetti and zetti and had enough for tomorrows lunch. The greek salads are wonderful. Every night has a special and well worth looking at if you like italian food. Friendly atmosphere great family food.

title: Ancient world
text: On a recent Viking Ocean cruise my wife and I had the pleasure of visiting the Acropolis. A great experience to be sure, and well worth the hike up. Site can be crowded so take your time. Also the walk up is steep so take your time and enjoy the views. Try and remember that this ancient wonder has been enjoyed by hundred of thousand over the centuries. It must have been a wonder back when it was build. If raining or wet the walk up can be slippery. We were there in the "off season" and it was crowded so I imagine it would be very crowded during the tourist season. I would guess that you can budget 1-2 hours to see and enjoy the experience.

title: Sunny Day in Charleston
text: Looking for a nice place for a fun luncheon try the Rarebit. Typical sports bar with a little less sports and decent food. Service was quick and the server was friendly. We had four different meals and no complaints. The Impossible Burger was interesting and worth trying.

title: St Paddy's Day Surprise
text:
If you want to see Irish and have a little fun go to McKenna's Place.
We actually went there the day before St Paddy's and the place was jumping. Green everywhere. With a special menu featuring Irish dishes you had plenty to pick from. I recommend the corn beef sandwich and my wife had the corn beef dinner. Both were very good. The crowd was generous and we sat at outside tables that were setup to handle the overflow. The small Irish band was an added extra.

title: Long time enjoyment
text: We have been visiting Mikey's for over 20 years and still enjoy their pizza. Every time we visit New Smyrna Beach the first place we have to go to is Mikey's. Check on their specials because you can get two large pizza's for a little more than the price of one. Leftovers are always enjoyed by the family and make the pleasure of buy there even more enjoyable.

title: Great place to relax
text: Enjoy coming here in the spring to get away from the cold up north. Well maintained building and grounds. Easy access to the ocean. Nice pool convenient location. Comfortable beds, well supplied kitchen.

title: Wednesday night in Charleston
text: What a wonderful experience. Sat down to a three course meal and enjoyed every moment. A lot of the evenings enjoyment was due to our server, Denis. He had an excellent knowledge of not only the food but the right wine that goes with each item. His little stories made the night even more enjoyable. Go early, ask to be served by Denis, and enjoy the evening. By the way the food was excellent.
